page.title: 09SHELLEY NURSERY:WIGLEY
page.content: Shelley Nurseries at Wigley have 2 working glasshouses,each covering half an acre of ground.One is used for growing chrysanthemums and the other for tomatoes.(The unused glasshouses are let to Hilliers to plant trees and shrubs.)In winter it is not warm enough in the glasshouses,so they use gas heating.In an emergency,they use oil.If it gets too hot in summer,they have vents which are controlled automatically or manually. The nursery employs 6 people all year round and an extra person for summer help.The crops are packed at Shelley Nurseries,then collected by lorry and sent to markets all over the country. All the sales and deliveries are taken care of,so that the only worry for the workers is getting a good crop.
